# imageShape

**Instance Property**

The intended aspect ratio or shape of the content image.

## Declaration

```swift
var imageShape: TVContentItemImageShape { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the TV Content object is being used to represent Top Shelf items, then the allowed values for this property depend on the [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfProvider/topShelfStyle] property of the object that implements the TV TopShelf extension. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfProvider].

If the [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfProvider/topShelfStyle] value is [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfContentStyle/inset], the valid values of this property are:

- [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVContentItemImageShape/extraWide]

If the [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfProvider/topShelfStyle] value is [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVTopShelfContentStyle/sectioned], the valid values are:

- [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVContentItemImageShape/poster]
- [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVContentItemImageShape/square]
- [doc://com.apple.tvservices/documentation/TVServices/TVContentItemImageShape/HDTV]

If the value of this property is not valid for the current Top Shelf style, the system reserves the right to scale the image in any way.

## Inspecting the Content Properties

- **creationDate**: The date when the content item was created, or the date when it was first broadcast, or some other kind of origination date.
- **duration**: The amount of time required to play the media to completion.
- **expirationDate**: The date when the user will no longer be able to access the item.
- **TVContentItemImageShape**: An enumerated type that identifies the shape in which the content item should be displayed.
